subject: Education
title: Attachment Theory: How Love Shapes Learning
description: A quick win: understand Attachment Theory: How Love Shapes Learning.

hook.text: A baby who feels safe explores more. John Bowlby discovered that emotional security is the foundation of all learning.

buildup.text: Securely attached children are more curious, try harder, and recover faster from failure. The data is overwhelming.

discovery.text: The attachment figure doesn't have to be a parent. Teachers who provide warmth and consistency become secure bases too.

twist.text: Insecure attachment doesn't doom anyone. The brain stays plastic, and one caring adult can rewire the pattern.

climax.text: Before a child can learn fractions, they need to feel safe. Emotional security isn't soft â€” it's structural.

punchline.text: Learning starts with love. Everything else comes second.
